title: Switching Input Sources
content:
## What Are Input Sources?

Projectors accept video from multiple input ports:
- **HDMI1, HDMI2** - Digital HDMI inputs
- **VGA** - Analog VGA input
- **Component** - Component video input
- **Network** - Network display

You can switch between these inputs to control which device is projected.

## Switching the Input

**Steps:**
1. Click the **Input Source** dropdown button
2. Select your desired input from the list
3. Wait a few seconds for the projector to switch
4. The Status Panel will update to show the new input

**What happens:**
- The application sends an input change command
- The projector switches to the selected input
- Status Panel updates to show "Input: [Source Name]"
- History Panel shows "Input Changed to [Source] → Success ✓"

## Available Inputs

The dropdown shows only inputs supported by your projector model. If an input is missing, it may not be supported or enabled on your projector.

**Common inputs:**
- HDMI1 - Primary digital input
- HDMI2 - Secondary digital input
- VGA - Legacy analog computers
- Component - DVD/Blu-ray players
- Network - Wireless presentation systems

## Input Switching Tips

**Speed:**
- Most projectors switch inputs in 2-3 seconds
- Some older models may take 5-10 seconds

**Troubleshooting:**
- If input switch fails, check that the source device is connected
- Some projectors require specific input modes to be enabled
- Not all projectors support all input types

> **Tip:** Available inputs depend on your specific projector model. If an input is missing, it may not be supported by your projector.
